title: skmckay
text:
Welcome!
My name is Kyle McKay, and I am an ecological engineer working on integrated water resources management. My work blends expertise from hydraulic and hydrologic engineering with freshwater ecology to create interdisciplinary solutions to water resources and ecosystem conservation challenges. I usually find myself working on nature-based solutions, ecosystem restoration, water management, and complex socio-ecological systems, and I typically use diverse methods ranging from numerical modeling and field data collection to decision support and group facilitation. This website links to some of the methods, tools, publications, and other outcomes of this work. Although it is presented on my personal site, this work was developed collaboratively with hundreds of partners, and their contributions, insights, and expertise are gratefully acknowledged.

text:
Contact

New York, New York

title: Kyle McKay, Ph.D., P.E.
text: Dr. Kyle McKay is an ecological engineer with interests in nature-based solutions, ecosystem restoration, and ecological modeling. He is environmental director for Woolpert, an architecture, engineering, and geospatial company.

title: Kyle McKay, Ph.D., P.E.
text:
Education & Licensing
Ph.D., Ecology, University of Georgia, 2014
M.S., Civil Engineering (Environmental Hydrology and Hydraulic Engineering), University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, 2007
B.S., Environmental Engineering, Colorado State University, 2001-2005
Professional Engineer in Georgia (#PE040542), 2016-Present

title: Kyle McKay, Ph.D., P.E.
text:
Professional Appointments
Environmental Director – Woolpert, New York, NY, June 2025 - Present

Develop environmental services capabilities across the company with an emphasis on nature-based solutions and ecological data analytics.

Lead technical activities on cross-sector environmental projects.

Foster external partnerships and collaborations.

University Appointments

Adjunct faculty, University of Maine, Aug 2023-Present

Ad Honorem Advisory Committee Member, University of Puerto Rico – Mayagüez, Department of Marine Sciences, Nov 2022-Present

Adjunct faculty, UGA Odum School of Ecology, Jan 2022-Present

Adjunct faculty, Department of Earth & Environmental Sciences, Brooklyn College, The City University of New York, Aug 2021-Present

Leadership Team, Network for Engineering with Nature (multi-institutional partnership led by ERDC and UGA), Aug 2020-Present

Affiliate faculty, UGA Center for Integrative Conservation Research, Mar 2015-Present

Adjunct faculty, UGA Warnell School of Forestry & Natural Resources, Nov 2014-Present

Senior Research Civil Engineer (GS-15 Equivalent) – U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), Environmental Laboratory (EL), New York, New York, August 2021 - May 2025

Led the Water Research Integrating Socio-ecological and Engineered Systems Team with 20+ team members and dozens of partners in executing $2.4M annual portfolio.

Established and executed the strategic vision for the team’s research portfolio investigating topics related to integrated water resource management, ecosystem restoration, nature-based solutions, ecological modeling, Engineering with Nature®, urban streams, river engineering, coastal storm risk management, and crisis and disaster management.

Contributed to dozens of USACE projects across ecosystem restoration, flood risk management, and navigation business lines.

Served as a formal liaison officer to USACE’s New York District.

Advised large-scale activities such as the National Nature Assessment (led by the White House’s Office of Science and Technology Policy), the Upper Mississippi Navigation and Ecosystem Sustainability Program, and the NY/NJ Harbor and Tributaries Study.

Other USACE Appointments:

Research Civil Engineer (GS-13/14 Equivalent), New York, New York, August 2016 - July 2021.

Research Civil Engineer (GS-12/13 Equivalent), Athens, Georgia, October 2011 - July 2016.

Research Civil Engineer (GS-11 Equivalent), Athens, Georgia, August 2007 - October 2011.

Contractor, USACE Environmental Laboratory, Vicksburg, Mississippi, Summer 2005 and 2007.

Technician, USACE Coastal and Hydraulics Laboratory, Vicksburg, Mississippi, Summer 2001 and 2002.
